data.title: Potomac Technical Processing Librarians
data.text:
Conference/Meeting History

2019

Marymount University

Changes in the Electronic Resources Management Landscape: A Librarianâ€™s Toolkit

Speakers:

George Stachokas, Auburn University (Keynote: Electronic Resources Management on the Eve of 2020)

Leigh Ann DePope, University of Maryland College Park (Usage Statistics and COUNTER 5: Too much data for decision making?)

Amanda Echterling, Virginia Commonwealth University (Risk and Transformation in eResource Licensing)

Vendor Panel :

Jane Burke (Ex Libris), Sheri Meares (EBSCO), Matthew Ragucci (Wiley), and Bob Schultz (OCLC)

2018

American University Washington College of Law

Telling the Technical Services Story: Using Assessment & Data Visualization to Show Our Value

Speakers:

Rebecca Mugridge, University at Albany, SUNY (Keynote: Advocating for Technical Services through Assessment)

Gina Solares, University of San Francisco (Visualization as Sensemaking, or, Seeing the Forest and the Trees)

Jessica Schomberg, Minnesota State University, Mankato (We Rate Cats: How and Why We Assess Our Cataloging)

Nina Servizzi, New York University (Reinventing the Cataloging Hold: Smarter Processing Through Data Integration)

2017

University of Baltimore, UB Student Center

DISCOVERY & THE NOW GENERATION ILS: THE NEXT GENERATION IS HERE!

Speakers:

Penny Lochner, Muhlenburg College (What Should an ILS Do When Everything Continues to Change?/ .ppsx)

Peter McCracken, Cornell University (The (Actual) Next Generation of LMSs / .ppsx)

Mike Rogers, University of Tennessee, Knoxville (Alma: a Different Type of ILS)

Phil Schreur, Stanford University (The Three Faces of Discovery /.docx)

2016

University of Richmond, Jepson Alumni Center

BIBFRAME

Speakers:

Beacher Wiggins, Library of Congress (presentation)

Xiaoli Li, University of California, Davis (presentation)

Paul Frank and Kirk Hess, Library of Congress (presentation)

Tina Shrader, National Library of Medicine (presentation)

2015

Library of Congress (Washington, D.C.)

Exploring Linked Data

Speakers:

Dorothea Salo, Faculty Associate, School of Library and Information Studies, University of Wisconsin - Madison (presentation)

Jackie Shieh, Resource Description Coordinator, George Washington University Libraries (presentation)

Nancy Fallgren, Metadata Librarian, United States National Library of Medicine (presentation)

Linda Wen, Head of Collections and Bibliographic Services, Washington College of Law at American University (presentation)

2014

Miller Senate Office Building (Annapolis, MD)

REIMAGINING TECHNICAL SERVICES: Redesigning workflows, rethinking resources, reworking spaces, and reorganizing staff

Speakers:
